pullRequest.title: Otp2 dsj3 dated service journey
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR refactor the calendar import in Netex and add support for DatedServiceJourney(DSJ).
To be completed by pull request submitter:

 issue: No.
 roadmap: No
 tests: Full unit test coverage is added to the Netex import of calendar data.
 formatting: Yes
 documentation: The design doc for the Netex import is updated.
 changelog: No.

To be completed by @opentripplanner/plc:

 reviews and approvals by 2 members, ideally from different organizations
 after merging: update the relevant card on the roadmap

commit.message: doc: Update netex import documentation with collaboration and package diagrams and more doc.
Clean code: Move ServiceIdFactory to support package.
Clean code: Make all NetexMappers package local, except he main one.
Clean code: Rename dayOfWeek to dayOfWeeks (take a list of elements, not just one element).

nodes.bodyText: Allow some data to be shared, and group other data together. Each group should be isolated from other groups. This enable multi-threading, processing groups in separate threads.
nodes.diffHunk:

+## Design Goals
+
+- Import Transit data from NeTEx xml-files
+- Handle large input file sets (10 GB)
+- Allow some data to be shared and group other data together is an isolated scope

@@ -15,6 +14,19 @@ data quality should be fixed BEFORE loading the data into OTP. OTP will try to _
 data, allowing the rest to be imported. 
 
 
+## Design Goals
+
+- Import Transit data from NeTEx xml-files
+- Handle large input file sets (10 GB)
+- Allow some data to be shared and group other data together is an isolated scope 
+- Support for reading data fast, multi-threaded (the design support this, but not implemented jet)   
+- Warn or report issues on poor data, but keep building a graph so one "bad" line do not block the 
+  entire import.
+- The import should put any restrictions on the order of XML types in the files. If ServiceJourney
